definitions.definition: having a system of government in which the individual states of a country have control over their own affairs, but are controlled by a central government for national decisions, etc.
(within a federal system, for example the US and Canada) connected with national government rather than the local government of an individual state

examples.text: New federal regulations have been introduced.
On 15th February a federal judge ruled in their favour.
There is a plan to introduce random drug testing of federal workers.
We will continue federal funding for the arts.

wordOrigin: mid 17th cent.: from Latin foedus, foeder- ‘league, covenant’ + -al.
